definition.en: to make someone or something recline again
definition.zh: 使……再次斜躺；使……再次后仰

examples.en: The nurse gently reinclined the chair after the test.
examples.zh: 检查结束后，护士轻轻把椅背再次放倒。

extraExplanation: “reinclining”通常可理解为“re-（再次）+ recline（斜躺/后仰）”的现在分词/动名词形式，但在现代英语里并不常见。日常表达更常用“recline again / lean back again”。
“recline”常见搭配：recline in a chair（靠在椅子上）、recline on a sofa（躺在沙发上）、recline against a wall（倚着墙）。

summary.en: Reinclude means to include something again after it was removed or left out.
summary.zh: Reinclude 指在被移除或遗漏后，把某事物再次纳入/重新加入。

definition.en: to include something again; to put something back into a group, list, document, or plan after it was removed or left out
definition.zh: 再次纳入；重新把某事物放回某个群体、清单、文件或计划中（之前曾被移除或遗漏）

examples.en: We reincluded the deleted paragraph after the editor changed her mind.
examples.zh: 编辑改了主意后，我们把删掉的段落重新纳入了文章。

examples.en: Please reinclude my name on the guest list.
examples.zh: 请把我的名字重新加入宾客名单。

examples.en: The update reincludes features that were cut in the last version.
examples.zh: 这次更新重新加入了上一版本被砍掉的功能。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再一次 / 重新”。因此 reinclude = re-（重新）+ include（包含、纳入）。
“reinclude”在日常口语中不算常见，更常见的表达有：add back（加回去）、put back in（放回去）、include again（再次包含）。在写作、编辑、清单管理等语境中更容易看到 reinclude。

summary.en: “Reincluded” means included again after being removed or left out.
summary.zh: “reincluded”表示在被移除或遗漏后“重新纳入/再包含”。

definition.en: included again after being left out or removed.
definition.zh: 在被排除或移除后，再次被纳入；重新包含。

examples.en: The deleted paragraph was reincluded in the final version of the report.
examples.zh: 被删除的那段内容在报告的最终版本中又被重新加入了。

examples.en: After the review, several students were reincluded on the list.
examples.zh: 复核之后，有几名学生被重新列入名单。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of reinclude: to include again after excluding or removing.
definition.zh: reinclude 的过去式/过去分词：在排除或移除后再次纳入。

examples.en: We reincluded the missing files before sending the folder.
examples.zh: 我们在发送文件夹之前把缺失的文件又重新放了进去。

examples.en: The editor reincluded a citation that had been cut by mistake.
examples.zh: 编辑把误删的引用又重新加回来了。

extraExplanation: “reincluded”常见于正式写作（报告、合同、编辑修改记录等）。口语里更常说“put back in / add back / include again”。
构词：re-（再次）+ include（包含）。因此意思很直观：把原本不在里面的东西再次放回范围之内。

summary.en: “Reincluding” means adding something back in after it was excluded.
summary.zh: “reincluding”指把先前排除或删去的内容重新纳入/加入。

definition.en: including something again after it was left out or removed; adding it back into a list, group, document, or plan
definition.zh: 把之前遗漏或移除的内容再次包含进去；重新加入到清单、群体、文件或计划中

examples.en: We’re reincluding this chapter in the new edition because readers asked for it.
examples.zh: 因为读者提出要求，我们在新版中把这一章重新收录进去。

examples.en: After reviewing the data, the team decided on reincluding the outlier results.
examples.zh: 复核数据后，团队决定把那些离群结果重新纳入分析。

extraExplanation: “reincluding”通常是动词“reinclude”的现在分词/动名词形式（re- 表示“再次”，include 表示“包含”）。在正式写作里更常见的表达有：“including again / adding back / reinstating”。

summary.en: Reinclusion means including something again after it was removed or left out.
summary.zh: reinclusion 指把曾被移除或遗漏的内容再次纳入。

definition.en: the act of including something again after it was left out or removed; being added back into a group, plan, or document
definition.zh: 再纳入；重新收录：把曾被遗漏或移除的事物再次加入到某个群体、计划或文件中

examples.en: The committee approved the reinclusion of the deleted paragraph in the final report.
examples.zh: 委员会批准在最终报告中再纳入那段被删除的段落。

examples.en: Advocates pushed for the reinclusion of excluded communities in the policy discussions.
examples.zh: 倡导者推动在政策讨论中重新纳入曾被排除的群体。

extraExplanation: “reinclusion”由前缀 re-（再次）+ inclusion（纳入、包含）构成，常见于较正式的语境，如政策、编辑修订、法律文件或组织管理。日常英语里更常说 put back in / include again / add back。

summary.en: Reincorporate means to include something again, or (in business) to register a company again as a corporation.
summary.zh: reincorporate 指“再次纳入/重新并入”，也可指（商业）“公司重新注册成立为法人”。

definition.en: to include something again; to bring something back into a whole (a plan, a text, a group, etc.)
definition.zh: 把某事物再次纳入；将其重新并入整体（计划、文章、群体等）

examples.en: The editor reincorporated the missing paragraph into the final draft.
examples.zh: 编辑把缺失的段落重新纳入最终稿。

examples.en: After feedback, the team reincorporated several old features into the app.
examples.zh: 收到反馈后，团队把几个旧功能重新加入到应用中。

examples.en: The school tried to reincorporate the student into the class community.
examples.zh: 学校努力让这名学生重新融入班级群体。

definition.en: to form a company again or register it again as a corporation (often after changes in location, ownership, or legal structure)
definition.zh: （公司）再次注册成立为法人/股份公司；重新公司化（常因迁址、股权或法律结构变化）

examples.en: They decided to reincorporate the business in Delaware for legal reasons.
examples.zh: 出于法律原因，他们决定把公司在特拉华州重新注册。

examples.en: After the merger, the firm reincorporated under a new name.
examples.zh: 并购后，这家公司以新名称重新注册成立。

extraExplanation: 在商业与法律语境里，reincorporate 常指“重新注册/变更注册地或公司形式”，并不一定意味着公司“倒闭再开”，也可能只是为了税务、融资或治理结构更合适。
词形提示：re-（再次）+ incorporate（并入；使公司化）。写作中常与 into（reincorporate X into Y）或 as（reincorporate as...）连用。

summary.en: “Reincorporated” means included again or merged back into something; in business, it can mean a company was formed/registered again under corporate law.
summary.zh: “Reincorporated”指“再次纳入/重新并入”；在商业语境中也可指公司在法律上重新设立或重新注册。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of reincorporate) to include something again as part of a whole; to bring something back into an organization, system, text, or plan.
definition.zh: （reincorporate 的过去式/过去分词）把某事物再次纳入整体；把某内容重新并入某个组织、系统、文本或计划。

examples.en: The editor reincorporated several paragraphs that had been cut in the first draft.
examples.zh: 编辑把初稿中删掉的几段文字又重新加了回来。

examples.en: After months of negotiation, the two departments were reincorporated into one team.
examples.zh: 经过数月协商，这两个部门又重新合并成一个团队。

definition.en: (business/legal) to form a company again under corporate law, often in a different state or country, or after restructuring.
definition.zh: （商业/法律）依公司法再次设立或重新注册公司（常见于迁册到不同州/国家或重组之后）。

examples.en: The startup reincorporated in Delaware to attract investors.
examples.zh: 这家初创公司在特拉华州重新注册，以吸引投资者。

examples.en: After bankruptcy, the business was reincorporated under a new name.
examples.zh: 破产之后，这家公司以新名字重新注册成立。

definition.en: (adjective use) having been incorporated again; brought back into a whole.
definition.zh: （作形容词用）已被重新并入的；已被重新纳入整体的。

examples.en: The reincorporated sections read more smoothly now.
examples.zh: 重新加回去的段落现在读起来更顺畅。

extraExplanation: 在公司语境里，reincorporate 常指“重新选择公司注册地/法域”（例如从某州迁到 Delaware），或在重组后用新的法律主体继续经营。它强调的是法律与公司结构层面的“再次设立/迁册”，不只是一般意义上的“重新合并”。

summary.en: “Reincorporates” means adds something back again, or (in business) becomes a corporation again or in a new place.
summary.zh: “reincorporates”表示把某物重新并入；或（商业上）公司再次设立/在新地区重新注册为公司。

definition.en: includes something again as part of a whole; brings it back into a group, system, text, or plan
definition.zh: 把某物再次纳入整体；把它重新并入某个群体、系统、文本或计划中

examples.en: After the debate, the writer reincorporates the removed paragraph into the final essay.
examples.zh: 讨论之后，作者把删掉的那一段重新并入最终的文章中。

examples.en: The new policy reincorporates several rules that were dropped last year.
examples.zh: 新政策重新纳入了去年被取消的几条规定。

definition.en: (business/legal) forms a corporation again, or registers the same company as a corporation in a different place
definition.zh: （商业/法律）再次成立公司为法人实体，或把同一家公司在另一地区重新注册为公司

examples.en: The startup reincorporates in Delaware to attract investors.
examples.zh: 这家初创公司在特拉华州重新注册为公司，以吸引投资者。

examples.en: After restructuring, the firm reincorporates under a new legal entity.
examples.zh: 重组之后，公司以新的法人实体重新设立。

extraExplanation: “reincorporates”是动词“reincorporate”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it reincorporates）。
构词上：re-（再次）+ incorporate（并入；使成为公司）。在新闻和商业语境里，常见于“在某州/某国重新注册公司（reincorporate in + 地点）”。

summary.en: Reincorporating means integrating something again; in business it can mean forming a company again in a new legal place.
summary.zh: Reincorporating 指“再次并入/重新整合”；在商业法律语境中也可指公司在新的注册地重新设立。

definition.en: (Present participle of reincorporate) putting something back into a whole, system, or group; integrating it again after it was separated.
definition.zh: （reincorporate 的现在分词）把某物重新并入整体/系统/群体；在分离后再次整合进去。

examples.en: The team is reincorporating the missing sections into the final report.
examples.zh: 团队正在把缺失的部分重新并入最终报告。

examples.en: After the break, she focused on reincorporating exercise into her daily routine.
examples.zh: 休息一段时间后，她专注于把运动重新纳入日常作息。

definition.en: (Business/legal) changing a company’s legal incorporation again, often by forming the company in a different state or country.
definition.zh: （商业/法律）使公司重新注册成立（重新设立法人身份），常见于迁移到另一个州或国家进行公司注册。

examples.en: They are reincorporating the business in Delaware for legal and tax reasons.
examples.zh: 他们因法律与税务原因，正在把公司重新在特拉华州注册成立。

examples.en: The board discussed the costs and paperwork involved in reincorporating abroad.
examples.zh: 董事会讨论了在海外重新注册成立所需的成本与文件手续。

extraExplanation: 在日常语境里，reincorporate 多指“重新纳入/并入”（把内容、习惯、成员等加回去）。
在公司法语境里，reincorporate 常与“公司迁册/改注册地”相关：公司可能先在一个地区注册，后来为了法规、税务或融资等原因，在另一个地区重新设立公司主体。具体含义会因国家/州法律而异。

summary.en: Reincorporation means bringing something back into a whole; in business/law it can mean registering or forming a company again under a new legal setup.
summary.zh: reincorporation 指“重新并入/重新纳入”；在商业与法律语境中也可指“公司重新注册/重新成立（常伴随更换法域或法律结构）”。

definition.en: the act of adding something back into a whole or bringing it back into an organization, system, or group after it was removed or separated
definition.zh: 重新并入；重新纳入（指把某物重新加入整体，或让其在被移除/分离后回到组织、系统或群体中）

examples.en: The reincorporation of these costs into the final budget surprised the team.
examples.zh: 把这些费用重新纳入最终预算让团队很意外。

examples.en: After years abroad, he felt a slow reincorporation into family life.
examples.zh: 在海外多年后，他感觉自己在慢慢重新融入家庭生活。

definition.en: (business/law) the process of forming a company again or registering it under a new legal structure, often in a different state or country
definition.zh: （商业/法律）重新成立公司；重新注册（常指在不同州或国家以新的法律结构登记）

examples.en: The startup announced its reincorporation in Delaware for legal and tax reasons.
examples.zh: 这家初创公司宣布因法律和税务原因在特拉华州重新注册。

examples.en: Their lawyer handled the reincorporation paperwork in a few weeks.
examples.zh: 他们的律师在几周内办好了重新注册公司的文件。

extraExplanation: 词形拆解：re-（再次）+ incorporation（合并/并入；公司成立）。因此既可指“重新纳入/重新并入”，也可在商法语境中指“重新注册成立公司”。
近义词提示：一般语境可用 reintegration（重新融入）、reintroduction（重新引入）；公司法语境常见 re-incorporation / redomiciliation（公司迁址/重新归属法域，概念相关但不完全等同）。

summary.en: “Reincrease” means “increase again.”
summary.zh: “reincrease”意思是“再次增加/重新上升”。

definition.en: to increase again; to rise after having fallen or stopped rising
definition.zh: 再次增加；在下降或停滞后重新上升

examples.en: After a brief drop in sales, the company expects profits to reincrease next quarter.
examples.zh: 在销售额短暂下降后，公司预计下个季度利润会再次增长。

examples.en: If demand reincreases, prices may go up as well.
examples.zh: 如果需求再次上升，价格也可能上涨。

extraExplanation: “reincrease”比较少见，更常见的写法是带连字符的“re-increase”，表示“再次增加”。在正式写作中，也常用“increase again / rise again”来表达同样意思。

summary.en: “Reincreased” means “increased again,” often after a decrease, and it’s a less common form in modern English.
summary.zh: “reincreased”表示“再次增加/回升”，常用于下降后又上升的情况，但在现代英语中较少见。

definition.en: increased again; raised to a higher level after having decreased or stayed the same
definition.zh: 再次增加；在下降或持平之后又提高到更高水平

examples.en: After the discount ended, prices reincreased to their original level.
examples.zh: 折扣结束后，价格又涨回到原来的水平。

examples.en: The company reincreased the monthly fee to cover higher costs.
examples.zh: 公司再次提高月费以弥补更高的成本。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of “reincrease” (to increase again)
definition.zh: “reincrease”（再次增加）的过去式/过去分词

examples.en: Rates dropped in March but reincreased in April.
examples.zh: 费率在三月下降，但在四月又回升了。

extraExplanation: “reincreased”在现代英语中不算常见，更自然的表达通常是“increased again / rose again / went back up”。在正式写作里也常见写成“re-increased”（加连字符）以便阅读。
前缀“re-”表示“再次、重新”。因此“reincrease”字面意思就是“再次增加”，常用于价格、数量、费率等上下文。

summary.en: Reincreasing means increasing again after a decrease or pause.
summary.zh: Reincreasing 指在下降或停滞之后“再次增加”。

definition.en: increasing again after having decreased or stayed the same; becoming larger a second time
definition.zh: 在下降或停滞之后再次增加；再度变大/上升

examples.en: After two months of decline, prices are reincreasing.
examples.zh: 在下跌两个月后，价格正在再次上涨。

examples.en: The city is worried about reincreasing traffic during the holidays.
examples.zh: 这座城市担心假期期间车流量会再次增加。

definition.en: the present participle of re-increase: to increase again
definition.zh: re-increase 的现在分词：再次增加

examples.en: The company is reincreasing its production to meet demand.
examples.zh: 公司正在再次提高产量以满足需求。

extraExplanation: “reincreasing”在正式写作里更常见的写法是加连字符：re-increasing（表示“再次增加”的动作）。不加连字符也能见到，但可读性略差。
在商务、经济和数据报告中，更自然的替代说法包括：“rising again / increasing again / picking up again / rebounding”。

summary.en: Recrudate means to become active again (or make something active again), especially after a period of improvement.
summary.zh: recrudate 指（某事）在一段好转后再次发作/加剧，也可指使其复发/再度恶化。

definition.en: (Of a disease, conflict, pain, or problem) to become active or severe again after a period of improvement.
definition.zh: （指疾病、冲突、疼痛或问题）在好转一段时间后再次发作或加剧。

examples.en: After a week of feeling better, her fever recruded overnight.
examples.zh: 好转了一周后，她的发烧在一夜之间又复发了。

examples.en: Tensions recruded when the negotiations failed.
examples.zh: 谈判失败后，紧张局势又再度加剧。

definition.en: To cause something (especially a disease or problem) to flare up or return again.
definition.zh: 使某事（尤指疾病或问题）再次复发/再度恶化。

examples.en: Stopping the medicine too early can recrudate the infection.
examples.zh: 过早停药可能会使感染复发。

examples.en: Rumors can recrudate old fears in a community.
examples.zh: 谣言可能会重新激起社区中旧有的恐惧。

extraExplanation: 这个词比较书面、偏学术/医学或新闻评论用语，日常口语里更常用 flare up（突然加重/复发）、return、come back、resurface（再现）。
词源来自拉丁语 *recrudescere*，与 *crude*（“生的、未成熟的”）同源，原意有“重新变得生、重新冒出来”的感觉，因此常用于“复燃/复发”的语境。

summary.en: A rare word meaning a renewed outbreak or recurrence after improvement, especially of illness or violence.
summary.zh: 一个很罕见的词，指好转后再次爆发或复发，尤指疾病或暴力冲突。

definition.en: (Rare) The recurrence or renewed outbreak of something unpleasant—especially a disease, fever, or conflict—after a period of improvement.
definition.zh: （罕见）在一段好转或平静之后，（尤指疾病、发热或冲突的）复发、再度爆发。

examples.en: Doctors watched closely for any reincrudation of the fever after the antibiotics ended.
examples.zh: 抗生素疗程结束后，医生密切观察是否会出现发热的再次复发。

examples.en: After a brief ceasefire, there was a reincrudation of violence along the border.
examples.zh: 短暂停火后，边境地区暴力再次升级、重新爆发。

extraExplanation: “reincrudation”非常少见，很多词典不收；写作中更常用的是 **recrudescence** 或 **recrudation**（都表示“复发/再起”）。
词源上与拉丁语 *crudus*（“生的、未消退的”）有关，带有“症状重新变得明显/尖锐”的感觉，因此常见于医学或较正式的新闻、学术语境。
用法提示：如果你想表达“旧问题又回来了”，更日常的说法是 **a return/recurrence of…** 或 **flare-up**（尤指炎症、争端“突然加剧”）。

summary.en: “Reinculcate” means to instill an idea again through repeated teaching or reminders.
summary.zh: “reinculcate”表示通过反复教导或提醒，把某种观念/规则再次灌输、重新强化。

definition.en: to teach or impress an idea again, especially by repeating it until it is remembered or accepted
definition.zh: （通过反复强调）再次灌输；重新教导，使观念再次深入人心

examples.en: The coach had to reinculcate the team’s basic rules after the long break.
examples.zh: 长时间休息后，教练不得不再次向球队灌输基本规则。

examples.en: The workshop aims to reinculcate safe habits that people may forget over time.
examples.zh: 这场培训旨在重新强化人们可能会随着时间淡忘的安全习惯。

extraExplanation: “reinculcate”比较少见，更常用的表达是“reinforce”（强化）、“instill/inculcate”（灌输）、或“teach again”（再教一遍）。
词根提示：re-（再、重新）+ inculcate（反复灌输、谆谆教导）。语气通常带有“通过重复使其牢固”的意思，常用于规则、价值观、习惯等。

summary.en: “Reincur” (rare) means to incur something again, such as a fee, debt, or penalty.
summary.zh: “reincur”（罕用）指再次招致或再次承担某事物，如费用、债务或罚款。

definition.en: (Rare) to incur again; to become subject to (a cost, debt, obligation, or consequence) a second time.
definition.zh: （罕用）再次招致；再次承担（费用、债务、义务或后果）。

examples.en: If you cancel now, you may reincur the setup fee when you sign up again.
examples.zh: 如果你现在取消，之后再次注册时可能会再次承担安装费。

examples.en: Without proper maintenance, the company could reincur the same safety penalties next year.
examples.zh: 如果维护不到位，公司明年可能会再次招致同样的安全罚款。

extraExplanation: “reincur”在现代英语中非常少见，很多母语者也不常用。更自然的表达通常是：incur ... again / incur ... once more / be subject to ... again（再次承担/再次遭受）。
构词上是 re-（再一次）+ incur（招致/承担），含义清楚，但在正式写作里也更常直接用“incur again”。

summary.en: “Reincurred” means “incurred again,” usually referring to costs or negative consequences happening again.
summary.zh: “reincurred”意为“再次招致/再次产生”，多指费用或不良后果再次发生。

definition.en: past tense of re-incur: to become subject to (a cost, debt, or consequence) again; to have something happen again as a result of your actions
definition.zh: re-incur 的过去式：再次招致（费用、债务或不良后果）；因行为再次承担某种结果

examples.en: After missing another payment, the company reincurred late fees.
examples.zh: 又一次错过付款后，公司再次产生了滞纳金。

examples.en: By repeating the mistake, he reincurred the same criticism from his manager.
examples.zh: 因为重复同样的错误，他又一次招致经理的批评。

extraExplanation: “reincurred”在现实英文中比较少见，更常见的写法是带连字符的“re-incurred”（或动词原形“re-incur”），尤其在法律、财务、保险、合同等正式语境里。
“incur”通常与负面或成本类名词搭配（如 costs/fees/debt/liability/penalty），所以“reincur”也多用于“再次产生/再次承担”这类语义。日常表达里也可以用 “incur again” 来替换。

summary.en: “Reincurring” means “happening again as a cost, fee, debt, or obligation.”
summary.zh: “reincurring”指“费用/收费/债务/义务等再次产生”。

definition.en: incurring again; becoming a cost, debt, or responsibility once more (often used to talk about fees, charges, or obligations that happen repeatedly).
definition.zh: 再次产生（费用、债务或责任等）；又一次发生（常用于反复出现的收费、支出或义务）。

examples.en: Cancel now to avoid reincurring the annual membership fee next month.
examples.zh: 现在取消可以避免下个月再次产生年度会员费。

examples.en: If you miss a payment, you may be reincurring late charges every week.
examples.zh: 如果你错过付款，可能会每周再次产生滞纳金。

definition.en: the -ing form of “reincur”: to incur (a cost, debt, or obligation) again.
definition.zh: “reincur”的现在分词：再次招致/产生（费用、债务或义务）。

examples.en: By reopening the account, you are reincurring the service charges.
examples.zh: 重新开通该账户，你就是在再次产生服务费。

examples.en: He kept reincurring the same debt because he borrowed without a plan.
examples.zh: 他因为借钱没有计划，一再让同样的债务重新发生。

extraExplanation: “reincur”比较偏正式，常见于合同、账单、通知等语境；日常口语里更常说“pay again / be charged again”。
注意别和“recurring / reoccurring（反复出现）”混淆：reincur强调“再次产生费用/责任”，recurring强调“事件或现象重复发生”。

summary.en: “Reincurs” (from “reincur”) means to incur a cost, debt, or penalty again.
summary.zh: “reincurs”（源自“reincur”）表示再次招致或承担某种费用、债务或惩罚。

definition.en: to incur (a cost, debt, or penalty) again; to become subject to it again
definition.zh: 再次招致（费用、债务或惩罚）；再次承担/遭受

examples.en: If you pay late again, you may reincur the same fee.
examples.zh: 如果你再次逾期付款，你可能会再次产生同样的费用。

examples.en: The company changed its policy to avoid reincurring legal penalties.
examples.zh: 公司更改了政策，以避免再次招致法律处罚。

extraExplanation: “reincur”相对少见，更常见的表达是“incur again / incur the same costs again / be charged again”。在正式或法律/财务语境里偶尔会看到“reincur”。
“reincurs”是第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it reincurs）。更常用的形态还包括：reincurred（过去式/过去分词）、reincurring（现在分词）。

summary.en: “Reindebted” means indebted again—owing money or an obligation once more.
summary.zh: “reindebted”指“再次负债/再次欠下义务或人情”。

definition.en: indebted again; owing money (or a favor/obligation) once more, often after paying off an earlier debt.
definition.zh: 再次负债的；又欠下钱（或人情、义务）的，常指原先还清后又产生新的债务。

examples.en: After paying off his loans, he became reindebted when the business failed.
examples.zh: 他还清贷款后，生意失败又让他再次负债。

examples.en: They felt reindebted to the neighbor who helped them a second time.
examples.zh: 邻居第二次帮助他们后，他们觉得又欠了对方一份人情。

extraExplanation: “reindebted”并不常见，更常写作带连字符的“re-indebted”，尤其在正式写作中更清晰。
既可指“再次欠债（金钱）”，也可引申为“再次欠人情/恩惠”（moral/social debt），语境通常会说明是哪一种。
搭配上常见：become/be left re(-)indebted；feel re(-)indebted to someone（再次觉得欠某人情）。

summary.en: Reindebtedness means becoming indebted again—financially or in a sense of obligation.
summary.zh: Reindebtedness 指“再次负债/再次欠债”，也可引申为“再次觉得有义务或亏欠”。

definition.en: the state or situation of becoming indebted again (owing money or feeling an obligation once more)
definition.zh: 再次负债；再次欠债或再次感到有义务（再次“欠人情/欠债”）

examples.en: After the medical emergency, the family fell into reindebtedness.
examples.zh: 医疗紧急情况之后，这个家庭再次陷入负债。

examples.en: He feared reindebtedness if he used his credit card to cover rent.
examples.zh: 他担心如果用信用卡付房租，会再次背上债务。

examples.en: She spoke of reindebtedness not only in money, but also in gratitude to her mentors.
examples.zh: 她谈到“再次负债”不仅是金钱层面，也包括对导师们的感激之情（再次觉得亏欠）。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，多见于正式写作或学术语境；日常英语里更常说：getting into debt again / falling back into debt / becoming indebted again。
构词上由 re-（再次）+ indebted（负债的；受恩惠而感到亏欠的）+ -ness（名词后缀，表示“状态/性质”）组成。注意 indebted 既可指“欠钱”，也可指“受恩惠而感激、觉得亏欠”。

summary.en: A reindeer is a northern deer (also called a caribou in North America), famous in Christmas stories for pulling Santa’s sleigh.
summary.zh: reindeer 指北方的一种鹿（北美常叫 caribou），在圣诞故事里常被说成拉圣诞老人雪橇的动物。

definition.en: A large deer from northern regions (especially the Arctic and subarctic) with thick fur; both males and females usually have antlers. In North America it is often called “caribou.”
definition.zh: 一种生活在北方（尤其是北极与亚北极地区）的大型鹿类，毛厚；通常雌雄都有鹿角。在北美常称为“caribou（北美驯鹿/驯鹿）”。

examples.en: Reindeer can survive harsh winters because their fur is very thick.
examples.zh: 驯鹿能在严冬中生存，因为它们的毛非常厚。

examples.en: In North America, reindeer are often called caribou.
examples.zh: 在北美，驯鹿常被称为caribou。

examples.en: Many Christmas stories talk about Santa’s reindeer pulling his sleigh.
examples.zh: 许多圣诞故事都会讲到圣诞老人的驯鹿拉着雪橇。

extraExplanation: “reindeer”在英语文化里常与圣诞节意象绑定：最著名的是“Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer（红鼻子驯鹿鲁道夫）”，出自20世纪的故事与歌曲，使“reindeer”在节日期间更具象征意义。
词形上，“reindeer”单复数常常同形：one reindeer / two reindeer 都可以；也有人使用复数“reindeers”，但较少见，通常用于强调不同群体或种类。

summary.en: “Reindeers” means more than one reindeer, though “reindeer” is the more common plural.
summary.zh: “reindeers”表示“多只驯鹿”，但更常见的复数形式是不变的“reindeer”。

definition.en: Plural form of “reindeer”; animals (a type of deer) found in cold northern regions. The plural is often “reindeer” (unchanged), but “reindeers” is also used, especially when emphasizing different groups.
definition.zh: “reindeer（驯鹿/北美称驯鹿、欧亚多称驯鹿）”的复数；生活在寒冷北方地区的一种鹿。其复数常用不变形的“reindeer”，但也可以用“reindeers”，常用于强调“不同群体/几群驯鹿”。

examples.en: In winter, reindeer migrate in large herds.
examples.zh: 冬天，驯鹿会成群迁徙。

examples.en: The guide pointed to two groups of reindeers across the valley.
examples.zh: 向导指着山谷对面两群驯鹿。

examples.en: Children often learn about Santa’s reindeer in holiday stories.
examples.zh: 孩子们常在节日故事里了解圣诞老人的驯鹿。

extraExplanation: 用法提示：英语里很多动物名词复数可以不变形（deer, sheep, fish 等）。因此更常见的是“one reindeer / many reindeer”。“reindeers”并非错误，但频率较低，多用于强调“不同批次/不同种类或群体”的驯鹿。
文化背景：在北美与欧洲文化中，reindeer常与北极圈地区、萨米人/因纽特等北方民族的放牧与交通有关；在英语世界的流行文化里，也常出现在圣诞叙事（如 Santa’s reindeer）中。

summary.en: Reindependence means becoming independent again, especially for a country after losing independence.
summary.zh: reindependence 指“再次独立/重新获得独立”，多用于国家在失去独立后重新恢复独立的语境。

definition.en: the act or state of becoming independent again, especially after a period of control by another country, government, or power
definition.zh: 再次独立；重新获得独立（尤指在一段被他国、政府或势力控制之后）

examples.en: After decades of foreign rule, the nation celebrated its reindependence.
examples.zh: 在经历数十年的外来统治后，这个国家庆祝重新独立。

examples.en: Many people hoped the vote would lead to reindependence and self-government.
examples.zh: 许多人希望这次投票能带来重新独立与自治。

extraExplanation: “reindependence”不是特别常见的标准词，写作中更常见的是加连字符的“re-independence”，或直接用更自然的表达：regain independence（重新获得独立）、restore independence（恢复独立）、return to independence（回到独立状态）。
词形构成：re-（再次、重新）+ independence（独立）。多用于政治与历史语境，强调“曾经独立—后来失去—再次独立”的时间线。

summary.en: Reindex means to rebuild an index—most often in databases or search systems—so data can be found and organized correctly.
summary.zh: Reindex 指“重建索引”，最常用于数据库或搜索系统中，以便数据能被正确组织与检索。

definition.en: to create an index again, or to rebuild an index so information can be searched or organized correctly
definition.zh: 重新建立索引；重建索引，使信息能被正确检索或整理

examples.en: After we imported the new data, we had to reindex the database.
examples.zh: 导入新数据后，我们必须重建数据库索引。

examples.en: The search results looked wrong until the website was reindexed.
examples.zh: 在网站重新建立索引之前，搜索结果看起来不对。

definition.en: to adjust something so it follows a different index or set of reference values (used in economics/finance)
definition.zh: 按另一种指数或参考基准重新调整（常用于经济/金融语境）

examples.en: The contract was reindexed to inflation so payments change over time.
examples.zh: 合同改为按通胀指数调整，因此付款会随时间变化。

extraExplanation: reindex = re-（再次）+ index（索引）。在技术语境里常见于数据库、搜索引擎：重建索引可以修复检索异常、提升查询速度，但通常会消耗时间与计算资源。
在某些系统（如搜索服务）里，“reindex”也可能表示把旧数据按新结构/新映射重新写入到新的索引中，不只是“重新生成”那么简单。

summary.en: Reindexed means something was indexed again to update or rebuild how it’s organized for searching or finding.
summary.zh: reindexed 指“重新建立（或更新）索引”，让资料更容易被查找或搜索。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of reindex) to index something again—often to update, rebuild, or correct an index so information can be found or searched properly.
definition.zh: （reindex 的过去式/过去分词）重新建立索引；为……再建索引（常用于更新、重建或修正索引，以便更容易检索/搜索）。

examples.en: After the update, the database was reindexed to speed up searches.
examples.zh: 更新之后，数据库被重新建立索引，以加快搜索速度。

examples.en: The library system reindexed the catalog when new subjects were added.
examples.zh: 新增学科分类后，图书馆系统对目录重新建立了索引。

examples.en: My phone reindexed my photos overnight, so the search works better now.
examples.zh: 我的手机在夜间重新为照片建立了索引，所以现在搜索更好用了。

definition.en: Describing something that has had its index rebuilt or updated.
definition.zh: （形容）已被重新建立/更新索引的。

examples.en: The reindexed files appeared in the search results immediately.
examples.zh: 重新建索引后的文件立刻出现在搜索结果中。

examples.en: Use the reindexed table to find the correct page faster.
examples.zh: 用重新编排索引的表格能更快找到正确页面。

extraExplanation: 在计算机领域，“index（索引）”常指为了加速检索而建立的数据结构（如数据库索引、搜索引擎索引）。系统“reindex”通常发生在：数据大量变动、软件升级、索引损坏、或需要改进搜索/排序规则时。
在图书与学术写作中，index 也指书末“索引”（按主题或人名列出页码）。reindex 则表示重新编制/调整这类索引。

summary.en: “Reindexes” means “builds or updates an index again,” especially for databases/search engines; it can also mean “adjusts again according to an index.”
summary.zh: “reindexes”指“重新建立/更新索引”（尤指数据库、搜索引擎）；也可指“按某个指数再次调整数值”。

definition.en: (of a person or system) to create an index again, or rebuild/update an existing index so information can be found faster or more accurately (common in databases, search engines, and book/catalog systems).
definition.zh: （人或系统）重新建立索引，或重建/更新已有索引，以便更快、更准确地检索信息（常见于数据库、搜索引擎、书籍/目录系统）。

examples.en: The search engine reindexes the website every few days.
examples.zh: 搜索引擎每隔几天就会重新为这个网站建立索引。

examples.en: After we changed the database schema, the system reindexes the tables overnight.
examples.zh: 我们修改了数据库结构后，系统在夜间对数据表进行重建索引。

examples.en: If a page is missing from results, ask the crawler to reindex it.
examples.zh: 如果某个页面在结果中缺失，可以让爬虫重新索引它。

definition.en: to adjust something again according to an index (such as prices, wages, or benefits) so it matches current index values.
definition.zh: 根据某个指数（如物价指数）再次调整某项数值（如价格、工资或福利），使其与当前指数水平一致。

examples.en: The company reindexes salaries to inflation each year.
examples.zh: 公司每年会按通胀对工资重新调整。

examples.en: Some contracts reindex payments when the consumer price index changes.
examples.zh: 有些合同会在消费者物价指数变化时重新调整支付金额。

extraExplanation: “reindex”常见于计算机与信息检索领域：比如数据库为加快查询会建立索引（index），当数据量变化很大、索引损坏、或字段结构改变时，就需要“reindex”（重建/更新索引）。在搜索引擎语境里，reindex常指重新抓取并更新页面在搜索库中的记录。

summary.en: Reindexing means rebuilding or updating an index so a system (like a database or search tool) can find information correctly.
summary.zh: Reindexing 指重新建立或更新索引，让系统（如数据库或搜索工具）能正确检索信息。

definition.en: the process of rebuilding or updating an index (especially in a database or search system) so information can be found and sorted correctly
definition.zh: （尤指数据库或搜索系统中）重新建立或更新索引的过程，以便信息能被正确检索与排序

examples.en: The website was slow during reindexing, but search results became accurate afterward.
examples.zh: 网站在重新索引时变慢了，但之后搜索结果变得更准确。

examples.en: We scheduled reindexing at night to avoid interrupting users.
examples.zh: 我们把重新索引安排在夜间，以避免影响用户。

examples.en: After adding new products, the system started reindexing automatically.
examples.zh: 添加新产品后，系统自动开始重新索引。

definition.en: the act of indexing again; the present participle of “reindex”
definition.zh: 再次建立索引的动作；动词“reindex”的现在分词形式

examples.en: The app is reindexing the library, so some files may not appear yet.
examples.zh: 应用正在重新索引媒体库，所以有些文件可能暂时不会显示。

extraExplanation: “reindexing”多见于计算机领域：数据库（如重建索引以提升查询性能）、搜索引擎/网站（更新内容后让搜索结果反映最新页面）、以及文件管理或照片应用（重新扫描并建立可搜索的目录）。
与“reindexing”常一起出现的词：rebuild an index（重建索引）、update/refresh the index（更新索引）、index corruption（索引损坏）、indexing job/task（索引任务）。

summary.en: Reindicate means to indicate or show something again, usually for clarity or confirmation.
summary.zh: Reindicate 指“再次指示或表明”，多用于澄清或确认。

definition.en: to indicate again; to point out or signal something a second time (often to clarify or confirm).
definition.zh: 再次指示；再度表明（常用于澄清或确认）。

examples.en: Please reindicate which option you chose on the form.
examples.zh: 请在表格上再次标明你选择了哪个选项。

examples.en: The chart reindicates the trend we saw last year: prices are rising.
examples.zh: 这张图再次显示了我们去年看到的趋势：价格在上涨。

definition.en: (less common) to show again as evidence or a sign; to reaffirm.
definition.zh: （较少见）再次作为迹象/证据显示；重申。

examples.en: Her latest test results reindicated that the treatment was working.
examples.zh: 她最新的检测结果再次表明治疗正在起效。

extraExplanation: “reindicate”是比较少见、偏正式的用词，常见替代说法有“indicate again”“show again”“restate”。在医学语境里，偶尔也会用来表达“再次提示/再次显示（某种指征）”。

summary.en: “Reindicated” means indicated or recommended again, often in medical contexts based on new information.
summary.zh: “reindicated”表示“再次被认为有适应证/再次被推荐”，常用于医学语境并暗示基于新信息的重新判断。

definition.en: (especially in medicine) judged or recommended again as appropriate or necessary; shown again to be the right choice.
definition.zh: （尤用于医学）再次被判断/推荐为合适或必要的；再次表明是正确选择。

examples.en: After reviewing the new test results, the same medication was reindicated.
examples.zh: 在复查新的检测结果后，同一种药物再次被建议使用。

examples.en: Surgery was reindicated because the symptoms returned.
examples.zh: 由于症状复发，手术再次被认为是适应的治疗方案。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “reindicate”: to indicate or point out again; to recommend again (often based on new evidence).
definition.zh: “reindicate”的过去式/过去分词：再次指出；再次表明；（常基于新证据）再次建议。

examples.en: The report reindicated the need for better safety training.
examples.zh: 报告再次指出需要更好的安全培训。

examples.en: The guidelines were reindicated in the updated memo.
examples.zh: 这些指导原则在更新的备忘录中被再次强调。

extraExplanation: “reindicated”在临床语境里常与“indication（适应证）”相关：例如“Treatment is (re)indicated”表示“该治疗（再次）有适应证/仍然适用”。它强调的是医学上的“适用性判断”，不是单纯的“重复说明”。

summary.en: “Reindicating” means indicating something again, and it can also mean recommending a treatment again when conditions suggest it’s needed.
summary.zh: “reindicating”表示“再次表明/重新指出”；在医学语境中也可指“因病情需要而再次建议某治疗”。

definition.en: to indicate again; to show or point out something once more (often in technical or formal writing)
definition.zh: 再次表明；重新指出（多见于技术或较正式的表达）

examples.en: The updated chart is reindicating the same trend we saw last year.
examples.zh: 更新后的图表再次表明了我们去年看到的同一趋势。

examples.en: In the report, the author keeps reindicating that safety is the top priority.
examples.zh: 在报告中，作者不断重申安全是首要任务。

definition.en: (medicine) to recommend or justify a treatment again because the patient’s condition suggests it is needed
definition.zh: （医学）因病情需要而再次建议/再度适用某种治疗（表示“又有适应证”）

examples.en: The new symptoms may be reindicating the use of antibiotics.
examples.zh: 新的症状可能再次表明需要使用抗生素。

examples.en: After the relapse, the doctor considered reindicating the previous therapy.
examples.zh: 复发后，医生考虑再次采用之前的治疗方案。

extraExplanation: “reindicating”是动词“reindicate”的现在分词/动名词形式，由“re-（再次）+ indicate（表明）”构成。这个词在日常英语中比较少见，更常见的替代表达有“indicate again”“restate”“reaffirm”。
在医学语境里，有时用来表达“再次出现适应证/再次提示需要某治疗”的意思；更常见的说法也包括“be indicated again”或“re-evaluate the indication”。

summary.en: Reindication means a renewed reason or evidence to use a treatment/test again, especially in medical contexts.
summary.zh: reindication 指（尤在医学中）再次出现的适应证，即重新有理由或证据再次使用某治疗/检查。

definition.en: (especially in medicine) A renewed or repeated indication—i.e., evidence or reasons that a treatment, test, or drug should be used again.
definition.zh: （尤用于医学）重新/再次适应证；指再次出现的证据或理由，说明某项治疗、检查或药物需要再次使用。

examples.en: After the patient’s symptoms returned, the doctor noted a reindication for the same therapy.
examples.zh: 患者症状复发后，医生认为同一治疗再次出现了适应证。

examples.en: The guidelines describe reindication criteria for restarting anticoagulant medication.
examples.zh: 指南描述了重新启动抗凝药物的再次适应证标准。

definition.en: The act of indicating, pointing out, or stating something again (less common; more general use).
definition.zh: 再次指出/再次说明的行为（较少见；更一般性的用法）。

examples.en: The report included a reindication of the main risks for readers.
examples.zh: 报告再次强调了主要风险，提醒读者注意。

extraExplanation: “reindication”多见于临床与药学语境，常指“重新评估后再次符合使用条件”。更常见的写法是带连字符的“re-indication”。
在医学英语里，“indication”=“适应证/适应症”（什么时候该用某治疗）；因此“reindication”强调“再次满足适应证”，不等同于“重复用药”本身。

summary.en: Reindict means to indict someone again, usually after an earlier indictment is dismissed or modified.
summary.zh: reindict 指“再次起诉（再次提出起诉书）”，通常发生在先前起诉被撤销或需要调整之后。

definition.en: (of a prosecutor or grand jury) to indict someone again, especially after the first indictment was dismissed or changed.
definition.zh: （检察官或大陪审团）对某人再次提出刑事起诉（再次提起公诉），尤指原先的起诉被撤销、驳回或需要修改后。

examples.en: After the judge dismissed the case, prosecutors moved to reindict him on revised charges.
examples.zh: 法官驳回案件后，检方决定以修订后的罪名再次起诉他。

examples.en: The grand jury may reindict if new evidence is presented.
examples.zh: 如果出现新的证据，大陪审团可能会再次提出起诉。

examples.en: She was reindicted for the same conduct, but under a different statute.
examples.zh: 她因同一行为被再次起诉，但依据的是不同的法律条款。

extraExplanation: 这是典型的法律用语，常见于美国刑事司法语境：indict 指“大陪审团正式起诉/提出起诉书”。reindict 往往发生在起诉书被撤销（dismissed）、程序有瑕疵、或检方需要调整罪名与事实描述时。
学习提示：re- 表示“再次/重新”，indict 来自拉丁语词根，和“宣告、指控”相关。读新闻时常见搭配：reindict someone on charges of...（以……罪名再次起诉某人）。

summary.en: Reindictment means bringing formal criminal charges again against the same person.
summary.zh: reindictment 指对同一被告再次提出正式刑事起诉。

definition.en: A new formal criminal charge (indictment) brought again against the same person, often because the first indictment was dismissed, had errors, or new evidence was found.
definition.zh: 对同一名被告再次提出的正式刑事起诉（再次/重新起诉书），通常是因为原起诉书被撤销、存在程序或内容错误，或出现了新证据。

examples.en: After the original indictment was thrown out, prosecutors sought a reindictment with corrected charges.
examples.zh: 原起诉书被法院撤销后，检方提出了修正罪名的重新起诉。

examples.en: The judge allowed the reindictment because the new evidence changed the case.
examples.zh: 法官允许重新起诉，因为新证据改变了案件情况。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，indictment 是“大陪审团（在美国联邦和部分州制度中）作出的正式起诉书”。因此 reindictment 通常出现在：起诉书因技术性问题被撤销、罪名需要调整，或检方希望用更清晰/更有力的指控重新提交。
不同法域程序不完全一样；有些地方不使用“大陪审团”制度，但英语新闻中仍可能用 reindictment 泛指“重新提出正式刑事指控”。

summary.en: Reindifferent means becoming indifferent again, though it is rare in modern English.
summary.zh: reindifferent 指“再次变得冷淡/漠不关心”，但在现代英语中很少用。

definition.en: (Rare) Becoming indifferent again; returning to a state of not caring much or not having a strong opinion.
definition.zh: （罕见）再次变得冷淡/漠不关心；回到“不太在意、没有强烈立场”的状态。

examples.en: After a few days, she grew reindifferent to the argument and stopped replying.
examples.zh: 过了几天，她又对那场争论变得无所谓，不再回复了。

examples.en: Public attention was intense at first, then slowly reindifferent.
examples.zh: 公众一开始关注度很高，后来慢慢又变得冷淡。

definition.en: (Rare, describing someone’s attitude) Showing renewed lack of interest or concern.
definition.zh: （罕见，形容态度）表现出“重新不感兴趣/不在乎”的样子。

examples.en: He sounded reindifferent when the topic came up again.
examples.zh: 这个话题再次被提起时，他听起来又一副无所谓的样子。

extraExplanation: “reindifferent”不是常见标准词，多数情况下英语会用更自然的表达：become indifferent again / grow indifferent again / return to being indifferent。
构词上可以理解为 re-（再次）+ indifferent（冷淡的、漠不关心的）。在正式写作中，如果担心读者不熟悉，建议改用上面那些更常用的说法。

summary.en: Reindoctrinate means to indoctrinate someone again—often implying strong, controlling persuasion.
summary.zh: reindoctrinate 指“再次灌输（洗脑）”，通常带有强制与负面含义。

definition.en: to teach someone (or a group) to accept a set of beliefs again, often in a strong or controlling way; to indoctrinate again
definition.zh: 对某人（或某群体）再次进行灌输式教育，使其重新接受一套信念；再度洗脑

examples.en: After the regime change, the new leaders tried to reindoctrinate students with a different ideology.
examples.zh: 政权更替后，新领导人试图用不同的意识形态对学生再次进行灌输。

examples.en: The documentary argues that the training program was designed to reindoctrinate recruits, not to encourage independent thinking.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片认为，该训练项目旨在对新兵再次灌输，而不是鼓励独立思考。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，加在 indoctrinate（灌输、教化）前，强调“第二次”或“重新把人拉回某种信念体系”。
这个词在英语里通常带有强烈的负面色彩，常出现在政治、宗教极端化、宣传（propaganda）、强制改造等语境中；如果只是“重新培训/再教育”，更中性常用 retrain / re-educate。

summary.en: Reindoctrinated means taught a set of beliefs again—often with strong pressure or control.
summary.zh: Reindoctrinated 指“再次被灌输思想/教义”，常带有强迫或操控的负面含义。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of reindoctrinate) to teach someone a set of beliefs again, especially in a strong or controlling way.
definition.zh: （reindoctrinate 的过去式/过去分词）再次向某人灌输一套信念或观点，尤指以强势或控制性的方式。

examples.en: After leaving the group, she feared she would be reindoctrinated if she went back.
examples.zh: 离开那个团体后，她担心一旦回去就会再次被灌输思想。

examples.en: The program was designed to reindoctrinate new recruits with the organization’s rules and values.
examples.zh: 该项目旨在再次向新成员灌输组织的规章与价值观。

definition.en: Having been taught a belief system again, often implying pressure or manipulation.
definition.zh: 被再次灌输某种信念体系的（常暗示有压力或操控）。

examples.en: He sounded reindoctrinated, repeating the same slogans as before.
examples.zh: 他听起来像是又被灌输过思想了，重复着和以前一样的口号。

examples.en: Some families worry about relatives coming home reindoctrinated.
examples.zh: 有些家庭担心亲人回家时已经被再次灌输思想。

extraExplanation: “indoctrinate/indoctrination”在英语里通常带有负面含义，强调“灌输”而不是“教育/讲解”。因此“reindoctrinated”常用于政治、极端组织、邪教、战争中的“再教育/洗脑”语境。
构词：re-（再次）+ indoctrinate（灌输教义、灌输思想）。在较中性的语境里，人们更常用 “retrained（再培训）/re-educated（再教育）/retaught（重新教）”。

summary.en: Reindoctrinating means teaching someone to accept a set of beliefs again, often in a forceful or controlling way.
summary.zh: reindoctrinating 指对某人“再次灌输”某套信念或官方思想，常带强势、控制或批判意味。

definition.en: (present participle) teaching someone to accept a set of beliefs again, often in a strong or controlling way.
definition.zh: （现在分词）再次对某人进行灌输，使其重新接受一套信念/思想体系，常带有强势或控制意味。

examples.en: The group was reindoctrinating former members who had started to question the rules.
examples.zh: 这个组织正在重新对那些开始质疑规则的前成员进行灌输。

examples.en: Some critics say the program is reindoctrinating students instead of encouraging independent thinking.
examples.zh: 一些批评者说，这个项目是在重新灌输学生，而不是鼓励独立思考。

definition.en: (present participle) training or re-training someone to follow the official ideas of an organization, government, or system.
definition.zh: （现在分词）让某人重新接受并遵从某个组织、政府或体系的“官方思想/路线”，带有政治或制度语境。

examples.en: After the leadership change, the party focused on reindoctrinating local officials.
examples.zh: 领导层更迭后，该党着重重新对地方官员进行思想灌输。

examples.en: The memoir describes a camp aimed at reindoctrinating prisoners.
examples.zh: 这本回忆录描述了一个旨在重新对囚犯进行洗脑式教育的营地。

extraExplanation: “indoctrinate/indoctrination（灌输/教化）”在英语里通常是贬义或至少带批判视角，暗示不鼓励质疑、以服从为目标；加上“re-”强调“再次、重新”。在中性场景更常用“re-educating（再教育）”“retraining（再培训）”“reorienting（重新引导）”，但这些词的语气和含义不同，不能完全互换。

summary.en: Reindoctrination means teaching someone again—often in a forceful, ideological way—to replace old beliefs with new ones.
summary.zh: Reindoctrination 指“再次灌输/再教化”，常带意识形态或强制色彩，用新观念取代旧信念。

definition.en: the process of teaching someone again, often to replace their previous beliefs with a new set of ideas (especially in politics, religion, or an institution)
definition.zh: 再灌输；再教化（再次教育，常指用一套新的观念取代原有信念，尤见于政治、宗教或机构环境）

examples.en: After the leadership change, the organization began a program of reindoctrination for its members.
examples.zh: 领导层更换后，该组织开始对成员进行再灌输的项目。

examples.en: Some critics said the training felt like reindoctrination rather than education.
examples.zh: 一些批评者说，这种培训更像再灌输，而不是教育。

extraExplanation: “Reindoctrination”由 re-（再次）+ indoctrination（灌输、教化）构成，常带有强烈的批评或负面语气，暗示“强行塑造思想”，而不只是“复习/再学习”。
使用时要注意语境：如果只是“重新培训、再教育”，更中性常用的说法是 retraining、re-education 或 refresher training；而 reindoctrination 往往用于描述带有意识形态或立场改造色彩的过程。

summary.en: “Reindorse” is a rare/old spelling meaning “to endorse again,” especially for checks or bills.
summary.zh: “reindorse”是较罕见/旧式拼写，意思是“再次背书”，多用于支票或票据转让语境。

definition.en: (Rare/old spelling) to endorse again; to sign the back of a check, bill, or document again to transfer it to another person.
definition.zh: （罕见/旧式拼写）再背书；在支票、汇票或文件背面再次签名，以把它转让给他人。

examples.en: The bank asked the payee to reindorse the check before it could be deposited.
examples.zh: 银行要求收款人在支票上再背书一次，才能存入账户。

examples.en: After receiving the bill, he reindorsed it to his supplier as payment.
examples.zh: 收到汇票后，他再背书转让给供应商作为付款。

extraExplanation: “reindorse”多见于较旧的英式或法律/票据语境中；现代更常写作 **re-endorse** 或 **reendorse**。
注意它很容易与 **reinforce**（加强、强化）混淆：reinforce 用于“增强力量/观点”，而 reindorse/re-endorse 用于“票据背书转让”。

summary.en: “Reendorsed” means endorsed again—either renewed support/approval or (in finance) a second endorsement on a check/bill.
summary.zh: “Reendorsed”指“再次背书/支持；重新认可”，也可指（金融）对支票/票据“再次背书（签名）”。

definition.en: to endorse again; to give support or approval again (often after a review or a change).
definition.zh: 再次背书/支持；重新认可（常用于复核或情况变化后再次表示支持）。

examples.en: The committee reendorsed the plan after the budget was revised.
examples.zh: 预算修订后，委员会再次认可了该计划。

examples.en: Several newspapers reendorsed the candidate in the final week of the campaign.
examples.zh: 在竞选的最后一周，几家报纸再次背书支持该候选人。

definition.en: (finance) to endorse a check or bill again, usually by adding another signature to transfer it to someone else.
definition.zh: （金融）对支票或票据再次背书（通常再加一次签名以转让给他人）。

examples.en: The bank asked her to reendorse the check because the first endorsement was unclear.
examples.zh: 银行要求她重新背书该支票，因为第一次背书不清楚。

examples.en: The bill was reendorsed to a new holder.
examples.zh: 该票据被再次背书转让给新的持有人。

extraExplanation: “reindorsed”多半是拼写错误，更常见的标准拼写是 **reendorsed**（英式也常见 re-endorsed）。
**indorse/indorsed** 是较旧或较少见的拼写，常见于法律或票据/支票语境；现代通用写法是 **endorse/endorsed**。
在日常英语里，reendorse 多指“再次公开支持/认可”；在金融语境里更接近“重新背书（签名）”。

summary.en: Re-endorsement means giving an endorsement again—either renewed public support or a second endorsement on a financial document.
summary.zh: Re-endorsement 指“再次背书/再次支持”，可用于公众层面的再次表态支持，也可指金融票据上的再次背书。

definition.en: (Often spelled “re-endorsement” or “reendorsement”) an endorsement made again—especially renewed public support for a person, product, or idea.
definition.zh: （常写作 re-endorsement 或 reendorsement）再次背书/再次表态支持——尤指对某个人、产品或观点的支持得到更新或重新确认。

examples.en: The governor’s re-endorsement of the bill helped it pass the final vote.
examples.zh: 州长对该法案的再次背书帮助它通过了最终表决。

examples.en: After the update, the company asked influencers for a re-endorsement of the product.
examples.zh: 更新之后，公司请网红对该产品再次背书。

definition.en: (Business/finance) a second endorsement written on a document (such as a check, note, or bill of exchange) to transfer it again or confirm it for a new purpose.
definition.zh: （商业/金融）在票据（如支票、本票、汇票）上的再次背书，用于再次转让或为新的用途进行确认。

examples.en: The bank required a re-endorsement before processing the transferred check.
examples.zh: 银行在处理转让支票之前要求进行再次背书。

examples.en: The form explains when re-endorsement is needed for a change of payee.
examples.zh: 表格说明了在变更收款人时何时需要再次背书。

extraExplanation: 你输入的拼写“reindorsement”更常见的标准拼法是 **re-endorsement / reendorsement**。其中 **endorsement**（背书/认可/代言）在美式英语中用 **-or-**（endorse），而英式有时会看到较少用的 **indorse**（-or- / -or- 与 -or-/-or- 的历史拼写差异）。在现代日常语境里，建议使用 **endorsement / re-endorsement**。

summary.en: Reindorsing means endorsing again—often signing a check again to transfer it to someone else.
summary.zh: Reindorsing 指“再次背书/再次认可”，常用于把支票等票据再背书转让给他人。

definition.en: to endorse again; especially (in banking/law) to sign the back of a check or other negotiable instrument again in order to transfer it to another person
definition.zh: 再次背书；尤指（银行/法律）在支票等可转让票据背面再次签名背书，以便转让给他人

examples.en: The shop asked him to reindorse the check before they could deposit it.
examples.zh: 商店要求他在支票上再次背书，才能存入银行。

examples.en: After receiving the check, she reindorsed it to her landlord as payment.
examples.zh: 收到支票后，她再背书转让给房东作为付款。

definition.en: (general) to support or approve something again publicly
definition.zh: （一般用法）再次公开支持或认可某事

examples.en: The organization reindorsed the policy after a new review.
examples.zh: 该组织在重新审查后再次表示支持这项政策。

extraExplanation: “reindorsing”多见于较正式的银行/法律语境。现代英语更常写作 **re-endorsing** 或用更常见拼写 **endorsing**（因为 **indorse** 是 **endorse** 的较旧/较少见拼写变体）。
在票据语境中，reindorse 通常暗示“已经背书过一次，又背书转给下一手”，和一般口语里“再次支持某观点”的用法不同。

summary.en: Reinduce means to induce or cause something again, often used in scientific or medical contexts.
summary.zh: Reinduce 指“再次诱发/重新引起”，多用于科研或医学语境。

definition.en: to cause something to happen again; to bring back a state, effect, or process that was induced before
definition.zh: 使再次发生；重新引起（之前被诱发的状态、效果或过程）

examples.en: The researchers reinduced the reaction by adding heat.
examples.zh: 研究人员通过加热重新诱发了该反应。

examples.en: After a short break, the teacher reinduced a calm mood in the classroom.
examples.zh: 短暂休息后，老师让教室里重新恢复了平静的氛围。

definition.en: (medicine/biology) to induce again, especially to restart labor, symptoms, or a biological response
definition.zh: （医学/生物）再次诱导，尤指重新引产、重新诱发症状或生物反应

examples.en: Doctors chose not to reinduce labor and monitored the patient instead.
examples.zh: 医生选择不再引产，而是改为监测病人的情况。

examples.en: The team reinduced immunity in the test animals after the first response faded.
examples.zh: 在首次反应减弱后，团队在实验动物身上重新诱导了免疫反应。

extraExplanation: “reinduce”由前缀 re-（再次）+ induce（引起/诱导）构成，语感偏正式，常见于科研、医学或较严谨的写作。日常表达里更常用 bring back / cause again / trigger again 等说法。

summary.en: “Reinduced” means “induced again”—something is triggered or caused a second time, usually in technical contexts.
summary.zh: “reinduced”表示“再次被诱导/引起/触发”，多用于科研或医学等技术语境。

definition.en: Induced again; caused, produced, or triggered again (often in scientific or technical writing).
definition.zh: 再次被诱导的；再次被引起/产生/触发的（常见于科学或技术语境）。

examples.en: The cells were reinduced to express the gene after the temperature was lowered again.
examples.zh: 温度再次降低后，这些细胞被重新诱导去表达该基因。

examples.en: Symptoms were reinduced when the patient was exposed to the allergen a second time.
examples.zh: 当患者第二次接触过敏原时，症状再次被诱发。

definition.en: Simple past / past participle of reinduce: to induce again; to cause something to happen again.
definition.zh: reinduce 的过去式/过去分词：再次诱导；再次使某事发生。

examples.en: Researchers reinduced the reaction by adding the catalyst back into the solution.
examples.zh: 研究人员把催化剂重新加入溶液，从而再次诱发该反应。

examples.en: The team reinduced labor because the contractions had stopped.
examples.zh: 由于宫缩停止，医疗团队再次引产。

extraExplanation: “reinduced”多见于论文、实验报告、医学记录等正式文本；日常英语里更常说 “caused again / triggered again”。
构词：re-（再一次）+ induce（诱导/引起）。注意该词通常强调“在同样或类似条件下再次被触发”。

summary.en: Reinducement means inducing something again—renewed persuasion or renewed initiation of a process, mainly in technical use.
summary.zh: reinducement 指“再次诱导/促使”，即重新劝诱或重新启动某个过程，多见于专业语境。

definition.en: the act of inducing something again; renewed persuasion, stimulation, or initiation (often used in technical contexts).
definition.zh: 再次诱导；再次劝诱/促使；使某事重新开始（多用于技术或专业语境）。

examples.en: The company offered a bonus as a reinducement for former employees to return.
examples.zh: 公司提供奖金，作为让前员工回来的再次劝诱措施。

examples.en: In some medical settings, reinducement may be discussed when treatment is started again after a break.
examples.zh: 在一些医疗场景中，如果中断后再次开始治疗，可能会提到“再次诱导”。

extraExplanation: “reinducement”在日常英语中很少见，更常见的表达是“re-induction / reinduction”（再次诱导/再诱导）或直接说“induce again”（再次促使/诱导）。
在医学语境里，“induction”常指“引产/诱导分娩”或“麻醉诱导”；若要表达“再次进行诱导”，通常会用“reinduction”。
构词：re-（再次）+ inducement（诱因/劝诱/促使）。如果你是在论文或专业报告中遇到它，通常是在强调“再次启动某过程”的动作或措施。

summary.en: “Reinduces” means “causes something to happen again” (third-person singular of reinduce).
summary.zh: “reinduces”表示“使某事再次发生/再次诱导”（reinduce 的第三人称单数）。

definition.en: (of a person, drug, or event) to cause something to happen again; to bring back a state or condition that had stopped.
definition.zh: （人、药物或事件）使某事再次发生；让已经停止的状态/情况重新出现。

examples.en: The doctor reinduces anesthesia if the patient wakes up during the procedure.
examples.zh: 如果病人在手术过程中醒来，医生会再次诱导麻醉。

examples.en: Stress sometimes reinduces the symptoms after a period of recovery.
examples.zh: 在恢复一段时间后，压力有时会让症状再次出现。

definition.en: (more technical) to restart a process by triggering it again, especially in science or engineering.
definition.zh: （较专业）通过再次触发来重新启动某个过程，尤用于科学或工程语境。

examples.en: The updated signal reinduces the reaction in the experimental system.
examples.zh: 更新后的信号在实验系统中再次诱发了反应。

extraExplanation: “reinduces”是动词“reinduce”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it reinduces）。常见于医学写作（如再次诱导麻醉、再次诱导分娩）或科研论文中描述“重新触发/再次引发”某种过程。
词缀提示：re- 表示“再次”，induce 表示“引起、诱导”。把它们合在一起就很直观：再次引起/再次诱导。

summary.en: “Reinducing” means causing something to happen again or bringing back a previous effect or response.
summary.zh: “reinducing”表示“再次引发/再次诱导”，让先前的效果或反应重新出现。

definition.en: causing something to happen again; bringing a previous effect, state, or response back
definition.zh: 再次引发；使某种效果、状态或反应重新出现

examples.en: The researchers are reinducing the cells to produce the same protein as before.
examples.zh: 研究人员正在再次诱导这些细胞产生与之前相同的蛋白质。

examples.en: Doctors avoided reinducing labor until the patient was stable.
examples.zh: 在病人情况稳定之前，医生避免再次引产。

examples.en: The teacher used a short review to help reinducing interest in the topic.
examples.zh: 老师用简短复习来帮助重新激发大家对这个话题的兴趣。

extraExplanation: “reinducing”来自动词“reinduce”（re- 表示“再次” + induce 表示“引发/诱导”）。常见于科研与医学语境：如“reinduce gene expression（再次诱导基因表达）”、“reinduce labor（再次引产/再度诱发分娩）”。
日常英语里更常用的替代表达包括：trigger again（再次触发）、bring back（使重现）、revive interest（重燃兴趣）。

summary.en: Reinduct means to officially bring someone into an organization or service again.
summary.zh: reinduct 指把某人再次正式纳入某组织或服务体系（如重新入职、入伍、入会）。

definition.en: to induct someone again; to officially bring someone back into an organization, job, or service after they have left
definition.zh: 再次接纳（某人）入会/入职/入伍；将（某人）重新正式吸收回某个组织或体系

examples.en: The company decided to reinduct the engineer after a year away.
examples.zh: 公司决定在那位工程师离开一年后重新办理入职。

examples.en: After the paperwork was approved, the soldier was reinducted into active duty.
examples.zh: 文件获批后，那名士兵被重新编入现役。

extraExplanation: “reinduct”由 re-（再次）+ induct（正式吸收/使加入）构成，常见于较正式的语境（如军队、组织、公司的人事流程）。日常英语里也常用“bring back”“re-enroll”“re-admit”“re-hire”等更口语的表达，取决于具体场景。

summary.en: “Reinducted” means “officially inducted again,” often in military or other formal membership settings.
summary.zh: “reinducted”表示“再次被正式引入/录入”，常用于军队或其他正式成员资格的语境。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of reinduct) to officially bring someone into an organization, position, or system again; to induct again (often used in military or formal membership contexts).
definition.zh: （reinduct 的过去式/过去分词）再次正式让某人加入某个组织、职位或体系；再次进行入伍/入会等正式引入（常用于军队或正式成员资格语境）。

examples.en: After a short break in service, she was reinducted into the National Guard.
examples.zh: 在短暂离开服役后，她被重新编入国民警卫队。

examples.en: The athlete was reinducted into the Hall of Fame after new evidence cleared his name.
examples.zh: 在新证据还清其名誉后，这位运动员被重新引入名人堂。

examples.en: Several employees were reinducted into the program to receive updated training.
examples.zh: 一些员工被重新纳入该项目，以接受更新培训。

extraExplanation: “reinducted”多见于正式或制度性语境：例如再次入伍/重新编入部队、重新宣誓就职、重新成为某机构成员等。日常口语里更常说“rejoined（重新加入）”“brought back（召回/带回）”。
拼写提示：re-（再次）+ induct（使正式加入/引入）。Induct 常见搭配有 “induct someone into…”（使某人加入……），因此 reinducted 也常接 “into”。

summary.en: “Reinducting” means inducting again—formally bringing someone (or something) back into a group, role, or system.
summary.zh: “reinducting”表示“再次正式引入/接纳”，常指把某人重新办理入职、入会或入伍等手续。

definition.en: Inducting someone again; bringing a person back into an organization, role, or service through a formal process.
definition.zh: 再次使某人入会/入职/入伍等；通过正式程序让某人重新加入某个组织、角色或服役。

examples.en: The company is reinducting former employees after the merger.
examples.zh: 合并后，公司正在重新办理前员工的入职手续。

examples.en: The army began reinducting veterans to train new recruits.
examples.zh: 军队开始重新召回老兵，让他们训练新兵。

definition.en: (Less common, technical) Reintroducing something into an induction process or system again.
definition.zh: （较少见，偏技术）把某物再次纳入“感应/归纳”的过程或系统中。

examples.en: The technician paused before reinducting the coil into the testing setup.
examples.zh: 技术员在把线圈重新放回测试装置前停了一下。

extraExplanation: “reinducting”来自动词 reinduct（re- “再次” + induct “使加入/使入职/使入伍；正式引入”）。在日常英语里更常见的是说“reinduct someone into + 组织/体系”，尤其用于公司入职、协会入会、军队服役等正式场合。
拼写提示：re- + induct 中间常写作 reinduct（不需要连字符），但在某些写作风格里也可能见到 re-induct。

summary.en: Reinduction means doing an induction process again (in medicine/training) or using induction again in logic/math.
summary.zh: Reinduction 指再次进行“诱导/归纳”的过程（医学/培训等），或在逻辑与数学中再次使用归纳法。

definition.en: the act or process of inducing something again; starting an induction process over (for example, re-starting anesthesia, labor induction, or an induction program)
definition.zh: 再次诱导；重新进行“诱导”过程（例如再次开始麻醉诱导、分娩引产诱导或重新进行入职/入学培训）

examples.en: The anesthesiologist prepared for reinduction after the patient woke up too early.
examples.zh: 病人过早醒来后，麻醉医生准备再次进行麻醉诱导。

examples.en: New employees who missed the first session attended reinduction training the next week.
examples.zh: 错过第一场的新员工在下一周参加了重新的入职培训。

definition.en: in logic or mathematics, a second or renewed use of induction (a proof or reasoning method)
definition.zh: （逻辑/数学）再次使用或重新进行归纳法（作为证明或推理方法）

examples.en: The author suggests a reinduction step to handle the updated assumption.
examples.zh: 作者提出一个“重新归纳”的步骤来处理更新后的假设。

examples.en: Reinduction is sometimes used when the original induction needs a stronger base case.
examples.zh: 当原来的归纳证明需要更强的基础情形时，有时会用到重新归纳。

extraExplanation: “reinduction”由前缀 re-（再次）+ induction（诱导/归纳）构成。它不是最常见的日常词，更常出现在专业语境：医学里指再次进行麻醉诱导或（较少）再次引产相关流程；职场/学校里可指重新进行“入职/入学指导（induction）”；在数学与逻辑中则偏向“重新做归纳证明/归纳推理”。
如果你想表达“重新欢迎并介绍新人入职”的活动，英式英语里常用 induction；美式语境更常说 orientation（入职介绍/迎新）。因此在商务场景里，reinduction 有时可替换为 re-orientation 或 repeat orientation（视公司用语而定）。

summary.en: “Reinducts” means officially inducting someone (or something) again, bringing them back into a group, role, or process.
summary.zh: “reinducts”指把某人（或某物）再次正式“引入/接纳”，让其重新加入组织、职位或某个过程。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “reinduct”) to induct someone again; to officially bring someone back into a group, office, or program.
definition.zh: （reinduct 的第三人称单数）再次“授予入会/入职/入伍”等资格；正式让某人重新加入某个组织、职位或项目。

examples.en: After a year away, the chapter reinducts returning members at the spring ceremony.
examples.zh: 离开一年后，该分会在春季典礼上为回归成员重新举行入会仪式。

examples.en: The company reinducts the manager into the role after the investigation clears her.
examples.zh: 调查澄清后，公司让这位经理重新回到原岗位。

definition.en: (less common, technical) to subject something to induction again, such as reintroducing an object into an electromagnetic induction process.
definition.zh: （较少见，技术用法）再次对某物进行“感应”处理，例如把物体重新置入电磁感应过程。

examples.en: The technician reinducts the coil to verify the readings are consistent.
examples.zh: 技术员再次对线圈进行感应测试，以确认读数一致。

extraExplanation: “reinducts”是动词“reinduct”的第三人称单数形式，结构是 re-（再次）+ induct（正式吸收/授予资格）。在日常英语里更常见的表达是“reintroduces / reinstates / inducts again”。
常见搭配场景包括：社团/兄弟会/荣誉协会（induct members）、军队或机构重新接纳人员、或典礼上“再次入会/入职”。

summary.en: “Reindue” is a very rare/obsolete verb meaning to clothe/cover again or to endow with a quality again.
summary.zh: “reindue”是非常罕见/古语动词，指“再次穿上/覆盖”或“再次赋予某种品质”。

definition.en: (Very rare/obsolete) to clothe or cover again; to put on (a garment) again.
definition.zh: （非常罕见/古语）再次给……穿上；再次覆盖。

examples.en: In some older texts, “reindue” can mean to reindue the body with garments after washing.
examples.zh: 在一些较老的文本里，“reindue”可以指洗完后再给身体穿上衣服。

examples.en: The actor was told to reindue his costume before returning to the stage.
examples.zh: 演员被要求在回到舞台前再次穿上戏服。

definition.en: (Very rare/obsolete) to endow or invest with (a quality) again.
definition.zh: （非常罕见/古语）再次赋予（某种品质/特质）。

examples.en: The writer used “reindue” to suggest the hero was reindued with courage.
examples.zh: 作者用“reindue”来表达英雄再次被赋予勇气。

extraExplanation:
“reindue”在现代英语里几乎不用，很多情况下可能是拼写错误。常见的可能目标包括：
- reinduce（再次诱发/再次引起，常用于医学或实验语境）
- reintroduce（重新介绍/再次引入）
- redo / renew（重做/更新）
如果你能提供原句，我可以帮你判断最可能的词和含义。

summary.en: Reindulge means to indulge again—returning to a pleasure or habit after stopping for a while.
summary.zh: Reindulge 指“再次放纵/重新沉溺”，即停了一阵后又回到某种享受或习惯中。

definition.en: to indulge again; to allow yourself to enjoy something (often a pleasure or habit) again, sometimes after stopping for a while
definition.zh: 再次放纵/沉溺；重新让自己享受某种（通常是快乐或习惯性的）事情，常指停了一阵后又开始

examples.en: After a month of dieting, he reindulged in dessert at the party.
examples.zh: 节食一个月后，他在聚会上又重新放纵自己吃甜点了。

examples.en: She promised she wouldn’t reindulge in online shopping, but the sale was tempting.
examples.zh: 她答应不再沉迷网购，但打折太诱人了。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，加在 indulge（放纵、纵容、享受）前，形成 reindulge，语气常带一点自嘲或内疚：明知不该却又做了。
在语境上，它常和节食（diet）、上瘾习惯（addiction/habit）、消费（shopping/spending）、娱乐（binge-watching）等搭配。

summary.en: “Reindulged” means “indulged again,” often in a treat or habit you had tried to limit.
summary.zh: “reindulged”表示“再次放纵/再次纵容”，常指又一次去享受曾经想克制的享受或习惯。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle) indulged again; allowed yourself or someone else to enjoy something again, especially something pleasurable or possibly unhealthy.
definition.zh: （过去式/过去分词）再次放纵/纵容；又一次让自己或他人享受某事，常指令人愉快但可能不太健康或不太明智的事。

examples.en: After months of dieting, she reindulged in chocolate cake on her birthday.
examples.zh: 节食几个月后，她在生日那天又一次放纵自己吃了巧克力蛋糕。

examples.en: He had promised to quit smoking, but he reindulged during a stressful week.
examples.zh: 他答应过戒烟，但在压力很大的一周里又复吸了。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再一次”。因此 reindulge = indulge again（再次沉溺/再次纵容）。常用于谈饮食、消费、坏习惯等语境；语气通常带一点“明知不该但还是做了”的感觉。

summary.en: Reindulgence means indulging again—returning to a pleasure or habit after stopping.
summary.zh: Reindulgence 指“再次放纵”，即在停止之后又回到某种享乐或习惯。

definition.en: the act of indulging again; a return to a pleasure, habit, or behavior after stopping or reducing it
definition.zh: 再次放纵；在停止或减少之后又回到某种享乐、习惯或行为

examples.en: After a month without sweets, her reindulgence started with one small cookie.
examples.zh: 戒糖一个月后，她的再次放纵从一块小饼干开始。

examples.en: He promised moderation, but weekends became a pattern of reindulgence.
examples.zh: 他答应要节制，但周末却变成了反复再次放纵的模式。

extraExplanation: “reindulgence”由前缀 re-（再、重新）+ indulgence（放纵、纵容）构成，是一个相对少见但语义透明的名词。日常写作中更常见的表达有 “indulging again / returning to old habits / relapse into indulgence”等。

summary.en: “Reindulging” means indulging again—returning to a treat or habit after limiting it.
summary.zh: “reindulging”表示“再次放纵/再次享受”，常指克制一段时间后又回去吃、买、做某件让人开心但可能不太健康的事。

definition.en: indulging again; allowing yourself to enjoy something (often a treat or habit) after stopping or trying to limit it
definition.zh: 再次放纵/再次享受；在停止或克制之后，又让自己去享受某种（常见为零食或习惯）

examples.en: After a month of dieting, she was reindulging in chocolate on the weekend.
examples.zh: 节食一个月后，她周末又开始吃巧克力解馋。

examples.en: He promised to quit smoking, but he ended up reindulging during a stressful week.
examples.zh: 他答应戒烟，但压力大的一周里还是又抽了起来。

definition.en: letting someone enjoy something again by giving or allowing it
definition.zh: 再次纵容/再次满足（他人）；重新给予或允许某种享受

examples.en: The grandparents were reindulging the kids with extra desserts.
examples.zh: 祖父母又开始给孩子们多加甜点，惯着他们。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，所以 reindulging 通常暗含“本来克制过、停过，后来又回去享受/放纵”的感觉。
语气上常用于饮食、购物、熬夜、抽烟等“明知不太健康但很想要”的行为；也可用于较中性的“重新享受某种乐趣”。

summary.en: Reindustrialization means rebuilding or expanding manufacturing and industry after decline.
summary.zh: Reindustrialization 指在衰退后重建或扩大制造业与工业生产的“再工业化”。

definition.en: The process of bringing back or expanding manufacturing and industrial production in a country or region, often after a period of decline (deindustrialization).
definition.zh: 再工业化；指在经历去工业化（制造业衰退）后，使制造业与工业生产回流或扩张的过程。

examples.en: The government announced a reindustrialization plan to create more factory jobs.
examples.zh: 政府公布了再工业化计划，以创造更多工厂岗位。

examples.en: Reindustrialization can strengthen supply chains by producing essential goods locally.
examples.zh: 再工业化可以通过本地生产关键产品来加强供应链。

examples.en: Some towns hope reindustrialization will revive their local economies.
examples.zh: 一些城镇希望再工业化能振兴当地经济。

extraExplanation: “reindustrialization”常见于经济、政策与新闻语境，尤其与“制造业回流（reshoring）”“产业政策（industrial policy）”“供应链安全（supply chain security）”等话题一起出现。
它通常被视为对“deindustrialization（去工业化）”的回应：工厂关闭、制造业岗位减少、产业外迁后，试图通过投资、补贴、基础设施、人才培训等手段重建工业能力。
相关词：industrialization（工业化）、deindustrialization（去工业化）、reshoring（回流生产）、nearshoring（近岸外包）。

summary.en: “Reindustrialize” means to rebuild or bring back industry and manufacturing after decline.
summary.zh: “reindustrialize”指在衰退或外移后重建或让产业与制造业回流，实现“再工业化”。

definition.en: to bring industry and manufacturing back to a place (such as a country or region), especially after decline or outsourcing
definition.zh: 使（国家、地区等）重新工业化；让制造业与产业回流（尤指在衰退或外移之后）

examples.en: The government announced a plan to reindustrialize the region by supporting clean-energy factories.
examples.zh: 政府宣布一项计划，通过支持清洁能源工厂让该地区重新工业化。

examples.en: Many voters want policies that will reindustrialize communities that lost manufacturing jobs.
examples.zh: 许多选民希望出台政策，让失去制造业岗位的社区重新工业化。

definition.en: to become industrial again; to rebuild a manufacturing base after a period of decline
definition.zh: 重新变得工业化；在一段衰退后重建制造业基础

examples.en: After decades of shutdowns, the city is slowly reindustrializing.
examples.zh: 在经历数十年的工厂关闭后，这座城市正在缓慢重新工业化。

examples.en: Some economies reindustrialize by investing in advanced robotics and worker training.
examples.zh: 一些经济体通过投资先进机器人技术和工人培训来实现再工业化。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，加上“industrialize（工业化）”构成“reindustrialize”。它常见于经济与政策语境，讨论“产业回流（reshoring）”“制造业复兴”等议题。
在新闻与政策讨论中，它不一定意味着回到旧式重工业，更常指向“高附加值制造”“绿色产业”“关键供应链”之类的现代工业体系。

summary.en: Reindustrialized means a place has developed industry again, especially after manufacturing declined.
summary.zh: reindustrialized 指某地在制造业衰退后重新发展工业，实现“再工业化”。

definition.en: (of a country, region, or economy) rebuilt or developed again with more industry and manufacturing, often after a period of decline.
definition.zh: （国家、地区或经济体）在工业或制造业衰退后再次发展、重建工业体系的；再工业化的。

examples.en: The city became reindustrialized after new factories and tech plants opened.
examples.zh: 新工厂和科技制造园区建成后，这座城市实现了再工业化。

examples.en: Some politicians argue that the economy must be reindustrialized to create stable jobs.
examples.zh: 一些政治人物主张经济必须再工业化，以创造稳定的就业岗位。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of reindustrialize: to develop industry again in a place that has lost manufacturing.
definition.zh: reindustrialize 的过去式/过去分词：使某地在制造业衰退后再次发展工业；推动再工业化。

examples.en: The government reindustrialized parts of the region by investing in steel and clean energy.
examples.zh: 政府通过投资钢铁与清洁能源，使该地区部分地区实现再工业化。

examples.en: Several towns were reindustrialized through supply-chain projects.
examples.zh: 多个城镇通过供应链项目被再工业化。

extraExplanation: “reindustrialized”常用于经济与政策语境，强调在“去工业化（deindustrialization）”之后恢复制造业基础。常见搭配：reindustrialized economy/region/city；reindustrialize manufacturing；push for reindustrialization。

summary.en: Reindustrializing means bringing manufacturing and industry back or rebuilding them, often after a period of decline.
summary.zh: Reindustrializing 指在衰退或去工业化之后，让制造业与工业重新发展与回归。

definition.en: the process of building up manufacturing and heavy industry again, especially in a region or country that has lost industrial jobs or factories
definition.zh: （尤指在去工业化后）重新发展制造业与工业体系的过程；再工业化

examples.en: The government is reindustrializing the region by supporting clean-energy factories.
examples.zh: 政府通过扶持清洁能源工厂来推动该地区再工业化。

examples.en: Many towns are reindustrializing after decades of factory closures.
examples.zh: 许多城镇在工厂关闭数十年后，正在重新工业化。

definition.en: describing actions, policies, or efforts aimed at bringing industry back
definition.zh: 描述旨在让工业回流或重建工业的（行动/政策/努力）

examples.en: A reindustrializing strategy often includes training workers for new manufacturing jobs.
examples.zh: 再工业化战略通常包括为工人提供新制造业岗位的培训。

examples.en: The report outlines reindustrializing policies focused on local supply chains.
examples.zh: 报告概述了以本地供应链为重点的再工业化政策。

extraExplanation: “reindustrializing”来自动词“reindustrialize”（re- + industrialize）。常见于经济与公共政策语境，尤其讨论“去工业化（deindustrialization）”之后如何重建制造业、供应链与技术能力。
在新闻与学术写作里，它常和“reshoring（回流本土生产）”“industrial policy（产业政策）”“supply chains（供应链）”“advanced manufacturing（先进制造）”等搭配出现。

summary.en: **Reined** means “controlled,” literally by pulling a horse’s reins, or figuratively by limiting feelings, spending, or actions.
summary.zh: “Reined”表示“控制/约束”：本义是拉缰绳控马，引申为克制情绪、控制开支或收敛行为。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of **rein**: to control or slow a horse by pulling the reins.
definition.zh: **rein** 的过去式/过去分词：用缰绳控制或放慢马的速度。

examples.en: She reined the horse to a stop at the gate.
examples.zh: 她拉紧缰绳，让马在门口停下。

examples.en: He reined in and waited for the others to catch up.
examples.zh: 他勒住马（放慢/停下），等其他人跟上来。

definition.en: to control or limit something (often feelings, spending, or power).
definition.zh: （引申）控制、约束某事（常指情绪、开支或权力）。

examples.en: She reined in her anger before replying.
examples.zh: 她在回答前先压住了怒气。

examples.en: The company reined in costs during the slowdown.
examples.zh: 在经济放缓期间，公司控制了成本。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配是 **rein in**（约束/收敛/控制），既可指拉缰绳让马慢下来，也可比喻“把某事收住”。
**rein**（缰绳/控制）不要和 **reign**（统治）混淆：发音相同，但意思不同。写作时很多人会把“rein in spending”误写成“reign in spending”。

summary.en: “Reiner” is most commonly a surname (a person’s family name). A rarer meaning is “someone who controls a horse with reins.”
summary.zh: “Reiner”最常见是姓氏（人的家族姓）。较少见的意思是“执缰者”，指用缰绳控制马的人。

definition.en: a family name (surname); also used as a given name in some cultures
definition.zh: 姓氏；在某些文化中也可作名字

examples.en: Dr. Reiner will speak at the conference tomorrow.
examples.zh: Reiner 医生明天将在会议上发言。

examples.en: Her last name is Reiner, spelled R-E-I-N-E-R.
examples.zh: 她的姓是 Reiner，拼作 R-E-I-N-E-R。

definition.en: (rare) a person who reins a horse; someone who controls or guides a horse with reins
definition.zh: （罕见）执缰者；用缰绳控制或引导马的人

examples.en: The reiner kept the horse calm during the parade.
examples.zh: 执缰者在游行中让马保持镇定。

extraExplanation: “Reiner”在英语里最常见是人名/姓氏，读音通常为 /ˈraɪnər/（类似“RYE-ner”）。在德语背景中它也可能与“rein（纯净的）”相关，但在英语语境下通常不当作形容词使用。
流行文化中，你可能会见到该名字（如《进击的巨人》中的角色 Reiner Braun），此类用法在英语里也按人名处理。

summary.en: Reinette most commonly means a European apple variety often used for baking; rarely, it can mean ‘little queen’ as a French-derived poetic nickname.
summary.zh: reinette 通常指一种欧洲常见的苹果品种（常用于烘焙）；少数情况下也可指源自法语的“ 小女王”式昵称或诗意称呼。

definition.en: a type of apple (or apple variety), especially European kinds often used for baking because they are fragrant and slightly tart
definition.zh: （一种）苹果品种名（常见于欧洲），常用于烘焙，香气足、微酸

examples.en: She baked an apple tart with reinette apples.
examples.zh: 她用“reinette”苹果烤了一个苹果挞。

examples.en: The market sold several reinettes with golden, slightly russet skin.
examples.zh: 市场上卖着几种reinette苹果，果皮金黄、略带粗皮（褐锈）。

definition.en: (rare) a ‘little queen’; a French-derived word sometimes used as a nickname or poetic term
definition.zh: （罕见）“小女王”；源自法语的词，有时用作昵称或诗意称呼

examples.en: In the old story, the child was called the reinette of the court.
examples.zh: 在那则古老故事里，那个孩子被称作宫廷里的“小女王”。

extraExplanation: “reinette”来自法语，和“reine（女王）”同源，原意带有“小女王/可爱的小女王”的感觉；后来常用来命名某些苹果品种。
在食谱或欧洲市场里看到 reinette / reinettes，多半就是指这种苹果（例如用于苹果挞、果酱等）。不同地区的具体品种可能不完全相同。

summary.en: Reinfect means to infect again, or to become infected again after recovery.
summary.zh: reinfect 指“再次感染/使再次感染”，强调在之前感染过之后又发生新的感染。

definition.en: to infect again after a person, animal, or place has already been infected (often used in medical or public-health contexts)
definition.zh: （在已被感染之后）再次感染；再感染（常用于医学或公共卫生语境）

examples.en: Some people can get reinfected with the virus a few months after recovery.
examples.zh: 有些人在康复后几个月可能会再次感染这种病毒。

examples.en: To prevent reinfection, wash your hands and avoid close contact with sick people.
examples.zh: 为防止再次感染，请洗手并避免与生病的人密切接触。

examples.en: The doctor explained that reinfection can happen if the immune response is weak.
examples.zh: 医生解释说，如果免疫反应较弱，就可能发生再次感染。

definition.en: to cause someone or something to become infected again
definition.zh: 使（某人/某物）再次感染

examples.en: Sharing towels can reinfect family members.
examples.zh: 共用毛巾可能会使家人再次感染。

examples.en: The unclean wound dressing may reinfect the cut.
examples.zh: 不干净的伤口敷料可能会使伤口再次感染。

extraExplanation: 词形提示：re- 表示“再次”，infect 表示“感染”，合起来就是“再次感染/再度感染”。常见名词形式是 reinfection（再感染）。
易混淆点：relapse 指“复发”（同一种疾病症状回来，原因不一定是再次被感染）；reinfect/reinfection 更强调“再次被病原体感染”。

summary.en: “Reinfected” means infected again after a previous infection (used as a verb form or an adjective).
summary.zh: “reinfected”表示在曾经感染后又再次感染（可作动词形式或形容词）。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “reinfect”: infected again after a previous infection.
definition.zh: “reinfect”的过去式/过去分词：在先前感染之后再次感染。

examples.en: He tested positive again two months later and was reinfected.
examples.zh: 两个月后他再次检测阳性，属于再感染。

examples.en: Some patients were reinfected with the same virus variant.
examples.zh: 有些患者被同一种病毒变体再次感染。

definition.en: (adj.) having been infected again; experiencing a second infection.
definition.zh: （形容词）再次被感染的；经历二次感染的。

examples.en: Reinfected people may still have symptoms, even if the illness is milder.
examples.zh: 再感染的人可能仍会有症状，即使病情较轻。

examples.en: The reinfected worker stayed home to avoid spreading it.
examples.zh: 那位再次感染的员工为了避免传播而留在家里。

extraExplanation: “reinfected”常见于医学与公共卫生语境（例如流感、COVID-19等）。它强调“先前感染过→后来又感染”，不等同于“relapse（复发）”，后者更偏向症状在同一次疾病过程中再次出现或加重。
词形拆解：re-（再次）+ infect（感染）+ -ed（过去式/过去分词）。在新闻报道或研究中也会用“reinfection（再感染）”作名词。

summary.en: “Reinfecting” means infecting again, either medically (a person/body part) or digitally (a computer/system).
summary.zh: “reinfecting”指“再次感染”，既可用于医学语境（人/部位），也可用于网络安全语境（电脑/系统）。

definition.en: to infect someone or something again after they have already been infected (often after recovery or treatment)
definition.zh: 再次感染；在已感染或治愈后又被感染

examples.en: If you don’t finish the antibiotics, you could get sick again or reinfect others.
examples.zh: 如果你不把抗生素吃完，你可能会再次生病，或把别人再次感染。

examples.en: The doctor warned that touching the wound with dirty hands may be reinfecting it.
examples.zh: 医生警告说，用脏手碰伤口可能会让它再次感染。

definition.en: to cause the same device, system, or computer to be infected again (usually by a virus or malware)
definition.zh: （设备/系统/电脑）再次被感染（通常指病毒或恶意软件）

examples.en: If you restore from an old backup, you might be reinfecting your computer with the same malware.
examples.zh: 如果你从旧备份恢复，可能会让电脑再次感染同一种恶意软件。

examples.en: They updated the security settings to stop attackers from reinfecting the network.
examples.zh: 他们更新了安全设置，以阻止攻击者再次感染网络。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次”，加在动词前常构成“再一次做某事”的意思：infect（感染）→ reinfect（再次感染）。
在医学语境里，reinfect 常强调“同一个人/部位在之前感染后又感染”。在公共卫生语境里，也可能指“把病原体再次传播给别人”。
在网络安全语境里，reinfecting 很常见，指设备清理后又因为旧文件、未修补漏洞或相同途径而再次中毒。

summary.en: Reinfection means getting infected again after a previous infection.
summary.zh: Reinfection 指在之前感染之后再次被感染（再感染/二次感染）。

definition.en: the act of becoming infected again (often with the same disease) after you have recovered or after an earlier infection
definition.zh: 再感染；二次感染（通常指在康复或已有感染之后再次感染同一种疾病）

examples.en: Doctors are watching for reinfection in patients who have recovered.
examples.zh: 医生正在观察已康复患者是否会出现再感染。

examples.en: Wearing a mask can help reduce the risk of reinfection in crowded places.
examples.zh: 在人多拥挤的地方戴口罩有助于降低再感染的风险。

examples.en: The study looked at reinfection rates over six months.
examples.zh: 这项研究观察了六个月内的再感染率。

extraExplanation: “Reinfection”常用于公共卫生与医学语境，尤其在流行病期间（如新冠、流感等）。它与“relapse（复发）”不同：relapse通常指同一次感染/疾病在未彻底清除后症状再次出现；reinfection更强调“再次被感染”，可能来自新的暴露或新的病毒/细菌株。
常见搭配：risk of reinfection（再感染风险）、reinfection rate（再感染率）、confirmed reinfection（确诊再感染）。

summary.en: Reinfections are infections that occur again after someone has already had the same disease before.
summary.zh: Reinfections 指同一种疾病在同一个人身上再次发生的感染（再感染）。

definition.en: new infections that happen again after a person has already had the same disease once before (often after recovery).
definition.zh: 再感染；指一个人在已经得过同一种疾病并（通常）康复后，又再次感染。

examples.en: Reinfections can happen when immunity weakens over time.
examples.zh: 当免疫力随时间减弱时，可能会发生再感染。

examples.en: The report tracked reinfections among healthcare workers.
examples.zh: 这份报告追踪了医护人员中的再感染情况。

extraExplanation: “Reinfection”= re-（再次）+ infection（感染）。医学与公共卫生语境中很常见，尤其用于讨论某种病毒或细菌在同一人身上“第二次或多次”感染。
注意区分：reinfection（再感染）通常指“先痊愈/清除病原体后又感染”；relapse（复发）更强调同一次感染“没有完全好”而症状回来；breakthrough infection（突破性感染）指“已接种疫苗后仍感染”。

summary.en: Reinfectious means able to infect again or cause reinfection.
summary.zh: reinfectious 指“能够再次感染/导致再感染的”。

definition.en: Able to infect again, or able to cause reinfection (a new infection after someone has already been infected before).
definition.zh: 能够再次感染的；可导致“再感染”（曾经感染过之后又发生的新一轮感染）的。

examples.en: Some viruses can remain in the body and become reinfectious later.
examples.zh: 有些病毒可能留在体内，之后又变得具有再次感染性。

examples.en: The doctor warned that the virus might still be reinfectious if he stopped treatment too early.
examples.zh: 医生警告说，如果他过早停药，这种病毒可能仍具有再次感染性。

extraExplanation: “reinfectious”在日常英语中比较少见，医学/科研写作里更常见的表达是“capable of reinfection / can cause reinfection（可导致再感染）”，或用名词“reinfection（再感染）”来说明。
构词：re-（再次）+ infectious（传染性的）。与“reinfect（使再次感染）”有关。

summary.en: “Reinfects” means infects again (after a previous infection).
summary.zh: “reinfects”表示“再次感染/再次传染（在之前感染之后）”。

definition.en: to infect (a person, animal, or thing) again after a previous infection
definition.zh: （使人/动物/物品）再次感染；再次传染

examples.en: The virus reinfects some people months after their first illness.
examples.zh: 有些人在第一次生病几个月后又被这种病毒再次感染。

examples.en: If you don’t finish the antibiotics, the bacteria may reinfect you.
examples.zh: 如果你不把抗生素按疗程吃完，细菌可能会再次感染你。

definition.en: (of a disease or germ) to infect someone again
definition.zh: （疾病/病菌）再次感染（某人）

examples.en: In rare cases, the parasite reinfects even after treatment.
examples.zh: 在少数情况下，这种寄生虫即使治疗后也会再次感染。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再次、重新”。所以 reinfect = infect（感染） + re-（再次）。
在医学语境里，reinfect（再感染）通常指“同一种病原体或相近变体在一段时间后再次引起感染”。不要与 relapse（复发：同一次感染/疾病症状再次出现）混淆。

summary.en: Reinfer means to infer again—to reach a conclusion again, often using new evidence.
summary.zh: reinfer 指“再推断、重新得出结论”，常用于有新证据后重新判断。

definition.en: to infer again; to draw a conclusion again (often after getting new information).
definition.zh: 再推断；重新得出结论（常指获得新信息后重新判断）。

examples.en: After we saw the new data, we had to reinfer what caused the error.
examples.zh: 看到新数据后，我们不得不重新推断错误的原因。

examples.en: If your first guess was wrong, read the passage again and reinfer the author’s meaning.
examples.zh: 如果你第一次猜错了，再读一遍文章，重新推断作者的意思。

extraExplanation: “reinfer”由 re-（再、重新）+ infer（推断）构成，但在日常英语中非常少见，更常用的表达是“infer again / infer anew / re-evaluate / reconsider your conclusion”。
在学术写作里偶尔会见到，用来强调“基于更新证据重新进行推断”的动作。

summary.en: “Reinferred” means “inferred again,” usually after reconsidering evidence.
summary.zh: “reinferred”意为“再次推断/重新推断”，通常指在重新审视证据后得出结论。

definition.en: inferred again; concluded something anew based on evidence or reasoning
definition.zh: 再次推断；依据证据或推理重新得出结论

examples.en: After reviewing the new data, the researchers reinferred the cause of the error.
examples.zh: 在复查新数据后，研究人员重新推断了错误的原因。

examples.en: From her silence, he reinferred that she didn’t agree.
examples.zh: 从她的沉默中，他再次推断她并不同意。

extraExplanation: “reinferred”是动词“reinfer”的过去式/过去分词，但在日常英语里很少用。更常见的表达是“inferred again / inferred anew / re-inferred / inferred once more”。
在学术写作或逻辑推理语境中，用它可以强调：结论不是第一次得出，而是在新证据、新前提或重新检查后“再推一次”。
拼写上有时会见到带连字符的“re-inferred”，用于避免读者把“re”与后面的词读成一体或产生歧义。

summary.en: “Reinferring” means inferring again—reaching a conclusion again, often with new evidence.
summary.zh: “reinferring”表示“再次推断/重新得出结论”，常含“依据新证据重新推理”的意思。

definition.en: inferring again; drawing a conclusion again (often using new information or a fresh analysis)
definition.zh: 再次推断；重新得出结论（常指基于新信息或重新分析）

examples.en: After reading the new report, the researcher started reinferring what caused the decline.
examples.zh: 读完新报告后，研究人员开始重新推断下降的原因。

examples.en: We’re reinferring her intentions from the messages, because the earlier assumption was wrong.
examples.zh: 我们正根据这些信息重新推断她的意图，因为先前的假设是错的。

extraExplanation: “reinferring”来自动词“reinfer”（re- + infer）。它在日常英语里很少见，更常见的表达是“infer again / re-infer”或“reassess and infer”。
常用于学术写作、数据分析或逻辑推理语境，强调“用新的证据/不同方法重新推出结论”。拼写上也可能写作“re-inferring / re-inferring”（带连字符更清晰）。

summary.en: Reinfest means to infest again after being cleared or treated.
summary.zh: reinfest 指在清除或处理后又再次发生害虫（或有害生物）侵扰/滋生。

definition.en: to infest (a place, person, or thing) again after it has been cleaned, treated, or cleared of pests or unwanted organisms
definition.zh: （在清除、处理后）再次侵扰；再次滋生（害虫或有害生物）

examples.en: If you don’t seal the cracks, roaches can reinfest the apartment within weeks.
examples.zh: 如果不把缝隙封住，蟑螂可能几周内就会再次侵扰公寓。

examples.en: The orchard was treated last month, but pests reinfested the trees after heavy rain.
examples.zh: 果园上个月刚处理过，但大雨过后害虫又重新侵扰了树木。

examples.en: To prevent bedbugs from reinfesting your home, wash and dry bedding on high heat.
examples.zh: 为了防止臭虫再次侵扰家里，要用高温清洗并烘干床品。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次”，加在“infest（侵扰、寄生、滋生）”前面，就形成“reinfest（再次侵扰/再度滋生）”。常见于害虫防治、卫生、农业等语境。
语感上，它通常暗示“之前已经处理过但又回来”的挫败感或反复性：例如灭虫后没做封堵/清洁，导致“reinfest”。

summary.en: Reinfestation means pests return after they were removed.
summary.zh: Reinfestation 指害虫在清除后再次出现或侵扰。

definition.en: the return of pests (such as insects or rodents) to a place after they seemed to be removed
definition.zh: （害虫或啮齿动物等）在看似已清除后再次回到某处的“再度侵扰/再度滋生”

examples.en: After the first treatment, the apartment had a reinfestation of roaches within two weeks.
examples.zh: 第一次处理后，这间公寓两周内蟑螂又再次侵扰。

examples.en: Sealing cracks and storing food properly can help prevent reinfestation.
examples.zh: 封好缝隙并正确存放食物可以帮助防止再次侵扰。

extraExplanation: 词形拆解：re- 表示“再次”；infestation 来自 infest（侵扰、寄生、成群出现）。因此 reinfestation 强调“清除之后又回来/又出现”。
使用场景常见于害虫防治（pest control）、公共卫生、农业与房屋维护语境。语气偏正式，日常口语里也常说 “the bugs came back / it got infested again”。
常见搭配：prevent reinfestation（防止再次侵扰）、risk of reinfestation（再度侵扰风险）、reinfestation rate（再度侵扰率）。

summary.en: “Reinfiltrate” means to infiltrate again—secretly enter or rejoin a place or system after being removed or leaving.
summary.zh: “Reinfiltrate”指“再次渗透/再次潜入”，强调在离开或被清除后又秘密进入或重新混入。

definition.en: to infiltrate again; to secretly enter or join a place, group, or system after previously leaving or being removed
definition.zh: 再次渗透；在离开或被清除后，再次秘密进入某个地点、组织或系统

examples.en: After the hackers were blocked, they tried to reinfiltrate the network using a new account.
examples.zh: 黑客被封锁后，试图用新账号再次渗透该网络。

examples.en: The agent reinfiltrated the organization under a different identity.
examples.zh: 那名特工以不同身份再次渗透进该组织。

extraExplanation: “reinfiltrate”由前缀 re-（再次）+ infiltrate（渗透、潜入）构成，常见于军事、情报、安全与网络安全语境。
它通常暗示“之前已经进入过，但后来退出/被发现/被清除”，因此强调“再次潜入”的动作。日常口语中更常用 re-enter secretly、infiltrate again 等表达。

summary.en: “Reinfiltrated” means “infiltrated again,” usually secretly (or, in medical use, fluid/medicine spread into tissue again).
summary.zh: “Reinfiltrated”意为“再次渗透/潜入”；在医学语境中也可指液体或药物再次渗入组织。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle) entered a place or group again secretly or gradually, often to gather information or regain access.
definition.zh: （过去式/过去分词）再次秘密地或逐步地进入某个地方或组织，常为获取情报或重新取得接触。

examples.en: After the team pulled back, the scout reinfiltrated the area at night.
examples.zh: 小队撤回后，侦察员在夜间再次潜入该地区。
